Elon Reeve Musk

"Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough."

Elon Musk at a conference (2018)

Elon Musk is succesful entrepreneur and businessman...

... but how many times did he fail to become the icon he is today?

1995
Unsuccesfully apllied for a job at Nescape.
1999
The first PayPal product was voted as one of the 10 worst business ideas
1999
Crashed his newly bought McLaren F1 worth $1 million
2000
Ousted from PayPal while on a honeymoon
2000
Almost died from cerebral malaria
2001
Russians refused to sell him rockets to send mice or plants to mars
2002
Russians turned him down again, this time was about SpaceX.
2006
1st ever rocket launch and 1st explosion
2007
2nd launch, 2nd explosion
2008
3rd launch, 3rd critical failure, but with Nasa satellites onboard
2008
Tesla and SpaceX on the brink of bankruptcy
2013
1st rocket failure while landing at the ocean
2014
Tesla Model S had several problems with spontaneous battery combustion
2015
4th rocket explosion at launch. 2nd and 3rd explosions when landing on a drone ship
2016
Model X deliveries delayed more than 18 months
2016
5th rocket explosion with Facebook's satellites onboard. 4th, 5th, and 6th critical failures while landing on a drone ship
NOW
In the end, Elon mastered the art of failing succesfully. His net worth is: $14.8 billion

If you have time, you should read more about this incredible human being on his Wikipedia entry.
